HEMAscRaper 2.0.0

    Scrape Tournament Data from HEMA Ratings

    get_tournament.Rd

    Internal function to scrape data from a specified HEMA Ratings tournament page. Extracts detailed fight statistics, including tournament metadata and match-level data.

    get_tournament(tournament_url)

    Arguments

    tournament_url

    Character string. URL of the specific tournament page on the HEMA Ratings website.

    Value

    A tibble containing detailed fight statistics with the following columns:

    event_id

    Unique identifier for the event. Integer.

    event_name

    Name of the event. Character.

    tournament_name

    Name of the specific tournament or discipline within the event. Character.

    tournament_category

    Category of the tournament (e.g., Mixed, Men's, Women's, Underrepresented Genders). Character.

    tournament_note

    Additional notes about the tournament (e.g., special rules). Character.

    tournament_weapon

    Weapon used in the tournament (e.g., Longsword, Rapier). Character.

    fighter_id

    Unique identifier for the first fighter in each match. Integer.

    opponent_id

    Unique identifier for the opponent in each match. Integer.

    stage

    Stage of the tournament (e.g., Pool, Finals). Character.

    fighter_score

    Score of the first fighter. Character.

    opponent_score

    Score of the opponent. Character.

    Details

    This function scrapes the specified tournament page on the HEMA Ratings website, extracting match-level information. The data includes event metadata, tournament categories, weapon types, and anonymized fighter placeholders where necessary.

    The function assumes the page structure on the HEMA Ratings website remains consistent. Any changes in layout may require updates to the scraping logic.

    Note

    This is an internal utility function and is not intended for direct use. It relies on `httr`, `rvest`, and `dplyr` for web scraping and data manipulation.
